description: From Ancient Greek θάλασσα (thálassa, “sea”) (see also thalass-) and -emia (“blood”) (from αἷμα (haîma)). The etymology is suggestive of the epidemiology of the disorder, which is more common in people of Mediterranean descent. First used in 1932.

entries.meaning: (medicine) Any of a group of inherited disorders in which the amount of hemoglobin in the blood is reduced.
